vniuersa totius ecclesiae authoritate breui plus errorum quàm fidelium christianorum ecclesia erit cernere lawful euery man publish abroade among people thinges hath deuised owne heade hath consulted church nay authoritie whole church short time shall see moe error church faithfull men christian againe si enim boc permittamus vt capitosus quisque lib de baptis malè feriatus bomo mox vt nouum aliquid insolens animo suo concepit c suffer euery hedie braynelesse fellowe sone hath cōceyued new thing mynd publish abroade gather disciple make new secte shorte time shal haue many sectes faction christe scarce greate payne labor brought vnitie euery church deuided againe many partes vvherefore haue singularelie vvith greate vvisdome labour alreadie restored true religion christe banished sworde persecution eyther moued terrified look well note craftes subtilties take hede pestilent windes diuers doctrine let none trouble gospell amongst set strife variaunce remember streame commeth dovvne highe mountaines caused much rayne snovve taking eueriething meteth vvith goeth greater strengthe aboundance vvater gathereth first remoueth place small stone vvith greater violence casteth dovvne strong bridge yea huge mightie rockes encreaseth strength nothing neuer greate force resist vvithstand end leueth nothing else behinde quàm inutilem luctum quaerelas inanes miseram vastatorum faultes lying vncomely iesting harde cholerike speaches whiche magistrate dothe commonly punysh corrected doe thinke punishemente stealing murther sharpe enough doe thynke feare discipline churche terrifie men vice feare deathe doe doubte whether ciuill magistrate hathe authoritye appoynte anye punyshemente suche lyke crime prescribed iudiciall lawe moyses thys nowe called controuersie whether goe aboute wring swoorde magistrate hand least order matter neuer drawne punishe vice consent appoyntment seigniorie c vndoubtedly seing churche common wealth doe embrace kisse one seing like vnto hypocrates twinnes sick together wel together laughed together weped together alwayes lyke affected breach common wealth haue proceeded hurt church want one lackes neither hoped common wealth shal florish vntill church reformed io whitgifte grant god thanked therfore shal measure state church florishing estate wise gouernment cōmon wealth shall haue great cause complaine burste oute moste hartie thankes vnto god humbly desire continuance therof say churche without fault affirme impossibilitie thinke faultes rather person lawes rather gouernours kinde gouernment neyther woulde haue men eyther puritanes donatistes anabaptist dreame church plato common wealth aristotle felicitie stoicks iuste man muche lesie make contention church deuide themselues al thing go according fantasie shal neuer quiet churche long church themselues presently best lyke surely rule certaine common wealth shal flourishthe rule c returned himselfe vntil church reformed may good token vnto v churche englande reformed bicause common wealth doth flourish neither doe speake flatter magistrate sewe quisshions vnder elbow pleaseth reporte speake god speake thinke rather vtter deliuer state churche also common wealth englande vnthankfull vnnaturall slanderous tongue séeke deface depraue defend vice negligence securitie man shall bolde readie tel euen best thereof time place occasion ministred duetie shall require shall woulde séeme farthest kinde flatterie c also certaine church shal euery daye decay vntill made euen grounde onlesse walles buylded ruines repaired 〈1 line〉 weight fal either quite pull downe common wealth leaue none whiche feare god take pleasure seeing salomon sayeth wisedome whiche worde god king doe gouerne prince doe beare rule wisedome eyther contemned neglected otherwyse abridged hir free full course prince magistrate consequently common wealthes eyther goe wrack decay least want muche flourishing estate wanteth word god hath appoynted stay howsoeuer comming sauioure christ amongst athenian lacedemonians romanes since comming dyners place wisedome hath ben heard may seme haue bin shewes eyther florishing tollerable common wealth yet neyther haue endured according prophecie daniell haue bene broken peeces much left sheard fetche fyre neyther yet kingdomes whiche haue knowledge gospell reuealed vnto looke long suffering pacience god towards wherwith ignorant kingdom haue ben borne benefite greater towardes towardes iudgement swifter grace offered vnto offered vnto bee refused made light especially shall fulfilled whiche prophet esay saith shall later day euery nation kingdom shal serue church shall destroyed syde full whole placing sauiour christe throne perpetuall stay stayed perpetuitie prince theyr seates io whitgifte true nation shall refuse word god offered vnto suffer christ wholly placed throne doubt god poure vppon nation plague hath done vpon al haue runne contempt would make reader beléeue bycause churche england doth admit kind gouernment therefore walles broken word god contemned christe suffered wholly placed hys throne admit gospell wholly gouernments magistrate take vpon office proper christ neyther yet authoritie word god limited vnto wordes might aptly haue bin spoken written state churche fraunce like kingdome refuseth gospell offered vnto cruelly persecuteth true professor excuse churche england contemne word god neither iustify whole church receiuing gospell offred bringing foorth frutes therof ought exhort euery mā highest lowest euen bowells iesus christ haue better regard thervnto least sayd vnto v sayd vnto church ephesus apoc 2 sed babeo aduersum te quod charitatem tuam pristinam c haue thing againstapoc 2 thee bycause thou hast forsaken thy former loue c hebrues 6 earthhebr 6 whiche drinketh yet wyned together againste christ phariseis saduces contrarie opinion yet enimyes doctrine christ turke pope contrarie religion yet doe conspire agaynst gospell papistes anabaptistes agrée eyther meaning howe haue called punishement papistes haue 〈◊〉 therefore counted cruell made moderate certaynely knowe heare onely selfe saye haue done minde bragge time leaue haue professed concernyng putting deathe herotickes doe professe still ready thereof gyue accompte tymes shal required although neyther man else haue heard teach doctrine professe thys one glance waye occasion gyuen speake matter wyll plainely vtter conscience grace god meane tyme cause shoulde better thoughte among papistes bothe theyr practise theyr doctrine eleane contrarie question answere doe church enimyes doe doe meaning might easily appeare circumstance see howe bee free faultes vnlesse done ignorantly wishe true owne sake wyll desire thee gentle reader marke conscience man sayth ioyned confederate papistes agaynst church papistes mislyke booke common prayer nothing else bycause swarueth masse booke poyntes lyke vnto men mislyke nothing else hath much lykelyhoode vnto iudge whether ioyned papistes woulde haue communion fellowship wyth neyther ceremony doctrine gouernment forsaking doctrine reteyne part theyr ceremony almost whole gouernment separate themselues three walles one woulde parted broade sea woulde beuided narrowe water maye make bridge come agayne displace truth gospell haue done tymes past woulde onely vnhorse pope also take awaye styrrops whereby shoulde neuer get sadle agayne beyng content wyth vnhorsed leaue ceremony gouernment especially styrrops whereby maye leape vp agayne occasion serueth content onely haue cut armes body antichristianitie would haue stumpe roote vp io whitgifte better haue bad excuse none word meaning playne shal appeare come thē thinke déede meaning would haue cōpelled come church communicate lordes supper v nowe ministred well knowne howe themselues refuse howe haue defaced church manner forme administring sacrament woulde doe might haue owne deuised reformation haue lawe owne handes tell lyke woulde sharpe seuere inough compelling men come speake opinion touching compelling men come churche vnto whiche come themselues whiche followeth replie haue sufficiently answered beforepag 51 haue declared howe straunge thing men cleane contrarie iudgementes opinion ioyne togither oppugning one selfe truthe papistes pretende one cause misliking booke cōmon prayer pretende cause misliking nowe ioyne defacing ouerthrowing followeth word thing whiche reproue booke godly moste bettered person stande defense booke haue poyntes papistrie great detestation peraduenture greater occupie themselues externall thinges small importance meane time theythe admonitors gratifie papist slippe ouer matter weighte substance euen principall poyntes differ wherefore comparison standeth vpon false grounde fully persuaded doo pope great good seruice woulde misse thing desire haue churche englande whiche hathe accursed vtterly defaced discredited haue meanes ouerthrowne forreyne enimies yet domesticall dissention fitter apter instrumentes coulde haue purpose vnder pretence zeale ouerthrowe whiche men haue buylded vnder colour puritie seeke bring deformitie vnder cloke equalitie humilitie would vsurpe great tyrannie loftyequalitie made cloke ambition lordlykenesse ouer parish euer pope ouer whole churche chiefe man segniorie pastor state degrée men soeuer else parishe yea prince hir selfe looke admonition especially seconde booke also tell whether wherefore glorious wordes mistes blinde eye simple lyke manner like purpose vsed anabaptistes agaynst zuinglius oecolampadius bucer suche like sincere professor wordin second edition vlt heereby manyfest papistes ioyntly doe seeke shake nay ouerthrow selfe foundation groundes pillers churche althoughe selfe instrumentes engine wherefore tyme awake oute sleepe drawe oute sworde kind gouernment realme established else reforme better freedome giuen men obey disobey list speake list list list breche opinion doctrine list must ende burst strange dangerous effect lord graunt vnto bountyfull 〈1 line〉 muste bee among shall bee lawfull christian man beare rule temporall kingdome acknowledge tytles honoure bountyfulnesse clemencie whyche gyuen vnto prince lawfull also bishop haue temporall dominion christe thys place dothe thynke vnlawfull christian bee magistrate neyther dothe forbidde bishoppes haue externall dominion sheweth difference betweene kingdome thys worlde kingdome teacheth kyngdome worlde kingdome distincte minister kingdome must respecte vsurpe kingdome worlde apostle thought bycause apostle therefore shoulde possesse kingdomes worlde therefore christe place condemneth false opinion c christe doth condemne magistracie among christian c dothe forbidde byshops haue externall dominion come vnto inheritaunce lawfull election verye harde matter bothe preache gospell exercyse temporall dominion yet selfe vnlawfull together ministerie keepe vse temporall dominion come ordinarily lawfully christe came trouble ciuill lawes ordinarie gouernmentes kingdomes worlde rather preserued gospell might preached quietly haec brentius ciuill authoritie ecclesiasticall person occasion wil giuen speake large hereafter christ sayde quicun que maior erit inter vos c musculus verie truly interprete place whome bucer agréeth whose woordes anabaptistesbuce 〈1 line〉 20 thynke able proue pertaineth christian beare rulemitth man together magistrate christian bycause christe saydethey 〈1 line〉 ear rule godl 〈1 line〉 serue disciple vos autem non sic consydering whyche godlylle according wil lord beare rule nihil minus quàm dominari imò maximè seruire tantò pluribus quantò pluribus praefuerint doe nothyng lesse beare rule deede yea verily doe moste serue euen vnto many doo serue ouer howe manye euer beare rule surely christe woulde haue apostle haue authoritie church themselues greately require obeyed bycause sought nothing vnto themselues saluation aud glorie god whome ruled gouerne church euery superioritie ruled suche beleeued woulde haue godlie bee obedient vnto interim nihilominùs seruierunt omnibus dominati sunt nemini yet meane tyme serued dominion ouer none also ciuill gouernmente euer greater dignitie moses bee feared authoritie power yet euer serued mo diligently humblye whiche neuer soughte thing himselfe tooke thing vnto himselfe c day nighte vttermoste power sought safetie people c beare office rule workes handes lorde gouerne sheepe pasture according doth else serue gouerneth andthe place math 20 generall therefore christ doth dehort bearing rule magistrate seeking rule dominion rather take saying lord generalitie restrayne apostle eò quòd omnino pius magistratus seruiat non dominetur habeat que per se omnia secundum praesentem domini cohortationem bycause godlie magistrate doth altogether serue beare rule hath whereof bicause infirmitie man neither attayne perfection thing whereby mighte speake thing spoken neither yet bee free errour thinges whiche hee speaketh giueth oute therefore argument neither iustifie saying expressed scripture also affirm left ordering euery priuate man churche haue chief care gouernment appoint shal thinke conuenient agréeable generall rule giuen scripture purpose neither contrarie thing haue written bothe also whiche immediatly foloweth contrarie self directly ad oppositum admonitiont c contrarie himselfe admonition agreeth answere conference may appeare owne wordes whereby lykewyse appeareth denye certayne thing lefte order churche bycause nature varyed tymes place person circumstance coulde set downe established euer yet left order church doe nothyng rule aforesayde dothe differ wordes myne also true nothing ceremony order discipline gouernmente churche suffered word god end doe authority place tende haue alledged matter eyther vnderstand selfe else quarell againste person cause admonition poynt defende sayeth directly thing placed infol 19 god church whiche lorde himselfe worde commaundeth although peraduenture shifte saying meane suche thing bée commaunded eyther generally specially yet whole discourse booke declareth meaning nothing ought placed church specially commaunded worde god séeing agrée church hath authoritie ordeyn ceremony make order whiche expressed woorde god remayneth bée considered wherein differ whiche thinke say churche england hath lawfully vsed authoritie suche ceremony order hath appointed nowe retaineth denie controuersie church england ceremony order vsed therein therefore adde saye howe doth follow certaine thing left order churche therfore make newe ministerie c whereby giue v vnderstande thing misselike church office name archbishop whiche vntruly call newe ministerie declared answere admonition oure ministerie gouernment church say thinges pleasure iustly truly spoken shall appeare proper place meane tyme sufficient tell vnwoorthy member churche whiche vniustly report vnchristianly slaunder without groundes sounde proofes condemne nothyng altered god hath ordeined fastyng wythout anye offence god doe thinke may doe lyke manner nowe bycause certayne churche rome manye wicked opinion bothe difference meates tymes c also merite ioyned theyr fastyng therefore contra fidem bonos more wythin compasse thys rule augustine perceyue repugnancie betwixte ambrose augustyne ignatius andthe replyer setteth father together eares without cause tertullian sabboth daye mentioned ambrose augustyne lordes daye whych call sundaye whereof ignatius tertullian speake saterday whych called sabbatum true myghte haue read epistle augustyne casulanus saith thus vvhereas aske whyther lawfull faste sabboth daye iibidem aunswere meanes lawfull truely neyther moyses helias oure lorde selfe woulde haue fasted fortie dayes together thys reason concluded faste lordes daye lawfull also notwythstandyng whosoeuer doth thynke thys daye oughte dedicated vnto fastyng doe obserue sabboth fasting shall gyue small offence churche epistle truely sabboth day case easie bycause church rome dothe faste also althoughe fewe eyther nexte farre faste lordes daye greate offence especially since detestable heresye manicheis muche repugnant catholike fayth moste manifestly contrarye scripture god hath bene openly knowen whych doe appoynte vnto hearer thys daye lawfull fasted wherby come passe faste lordes daye accompted horryble sée therefore howe maye deceyued great reading woulde séeme father agrée among selues haue faulted opposyng augustyne ambrose anye thing yet proued agaynst man may well vse theyr authoritie matter wythout inconuenience suppose knowe howe farre selues would beléeued wherevnto theyr authoritie extendeth lyke bothe ambrose augustine woulde haue done themselues moued men vnto much beyng citizen beyng straungers also like bene minister woulde haue time place reproued suche thing amisse bene duetie doe yet doe lykewise thinke would haue great respect aduertisement augustine gaue casulanus epistle wordes vti que cauendis est ne tempestate contayned holy scripture founde decreed councels bishop cōfirmed custome whole church varied innumerably diuers maners diuers region scarcely neuer cause found whiche men followed appoynting occasion offered thinke ought cut without doubt hitherto augustine therefore reciting wordes augustine place first haue omitted wordes going expresse mynde declare meaneth suche ceremony impedimentes obseruing god commaundementes hauing spoken suche manyfest wordes concludeth haue sayde sort omnia ita que talia c suche ceremony c whiche word haue fraudulently kept backe secondly augustine speaketh whiche materiall declaring augustine minde sentence ita vt vix aut omninò nunquàm inueniri possint causae quas eis instituendis homines secuti sunt scarcely neuer cause founde oute whiche men followed appoynting whereby playne also meaneth suche ceremony bée appoynted without reason cause yet latter ende addeth churche god beeing placed betwixte muche chaffe darnell dothe tollerate many thinges c farre defending multitude burdensomnesse ceremony consent poyntes saying augustine wherefore sentence nothing hotte pleaseth righte well bin commendation medled withall whose name héere recite thoughe haue written wordes yet place whiche haue qnoted doe affirme muche recite whiche might haue founde taken paynes searche thinke verily haue done founde little purpose therfore content passe ouer fynde faulte dumbe doctor nowe abyde speaking surely intend directed vnconstant guyde proue thing man denyeth hadde lesse laboure replying translate whole leaues small purpose sooner answered vpon lighte occasion haue made often digression take héede well assured offende lyke truly haue forgotten place digression without reason let reuerende modeste speaches passe recompence lyke neither sauoureth spirite god neither yet modest good nature stomack swelling rather person cause purpose place seke rule measure ceremony proue ceremony externall thing muche lefte discretion churche whiche discipline whiche consisteth admonition correction faultes seuerely thys church englande effecte saye voyde ergo hath much externall face church proue worde god preached truely reason thys sort seeke deface thys churche englande selfe groundes papistes doe althoughe another kynde proofe haue papistes else saye haue minister bycause rightly called consequently worde sacramentes discipline say effecte doe saye churche englande voyde preachyng▪ ministring sacramentes one saye worde churche englande purely preached sacramentes sincerely discipline seuerely administred wyth thys churche englande voyde agayne doe reason thus worde god truely preached bycause minister ryghtly proued elected haue one worde true preachyng one saye purely preached saye truely preached saynte paule thea cauill philipp gladde gospell preached althoughe purely woulde neuer haue gladde haue preached falsely truely againe inueygheth agaynst false apostle churche corinthe bycause preached worde vntruely bycause vsyng paynted word affected eloquence makyng great shewe learnyng tounges dyd preache gospell sincerely see one thyng preache truely thing preache purely see reason euill want good calling maye gyue occasion saye worde god sincerely taughte bycause lawfull ordinarie calling althoughe substaunce doctrine manner handlyng sainte paule speaketh philipp dyd faulte yet saynt paule sayth dyd preache purely bycause dyd contention enuie whyche faulte doctrine hym taughte therefore let men iudge howe iuste wayghtes expounde purely truely whyther thys confute men argumentes rather skirmishe wyth owne shadowes knowe papistes reason thus bycause haue minister therefore worde sacrament discipline churche denie haue worde sacramentes bycause holde worde sacrifice reason yet men charge haue neither antecedent consequent neuer sayde ministerie england yet euer conclude word sacrament discipline churche saying face churche dothe muche appeare whole proces booke dothe declare meane say haue scarce face churche graunte haue churche god wante ornamentes whiche shoulde haue throughe certayne deformed ragges poperie whiche shoulde haue churche dothe appeare hir natiue colour beautifull meete shoulde prepared glorious husbande sonne god say certaynely beleeue author booke conspired papistes ouerthrowe churche realme nowe certaynely neuer doe iniurie vnto goe purge manyfest slaunders neuer wherein sayde counsell dyd make magistrate gathered assembly voyces whereby made luke saythe heere paule barnabas ordeyned bicause beeing moderator election caused made assembled church tolde necessitie hauing good pastor gouernoures gathered voyces tooke heede nothing done lightly nothing tumultuously order conclude euill reason say doctor dothe bicause luke hath paule barnabas ordeyned mustesimilitudes weak argument admonishe bicause glorie muche thinke haue reasoned strongly haue vsed weakest kinde argument proue thing logitians saye similitudo rem illustrat sed non probat similitude maketh matter playne proueth easely ouerthrowne shewing vnlikelyhoode similitude agréeth euery citie muste haue watcheman euery flocke shephearde euery churche parishe muste haue watcheman pastour watchman shephearde office watche féede haue necessarie care ouer charge muste also spirituall watcheman shephearde haue care ouer people committed vnto true neyther proueth improueth thing question mighte well saye citie well watched flocke carefully looked vnto thoughe watcheman shephearde selfe meanes procurement iuste faulte founde eyther likewyse shephearde hathe broughte shéepe pasture maye bothe sure daunger haue meate sufficient presence necessarie doe sometymes visite also one watcheman eyther dothe watche continually muste necessitie haue reste supplie hys absence likewyse master shephearde hathe vnder eyther boye man supply absence whylest aboute matter shorte one shephearde hathe care ouer sundrie mennes shéepe sundrie flockes sundrie townes parish c dyuers suche similitude shepheardes watchemen mighte also vse proue many thinges contrarie meaning mighte also shewe vnto dissimilitude betwixte temporall shephearde spirituall shephearde vnreasonable shéepe féede selues meanes prouyde selues haue charge looke selues reasonable shéepe suche god hathe endued knowledge whome hée hathe lefte hys wóorde whyche conteyneth suffyciente saluation whome hathe charged reade heare shall also answere selues c finally▪ difference betwixte temporall meate drinke whiche soone digested therefore dayly renewed spirituall foode whiche continueth whereof hath sufficiently tasted shall hunger thirst c saye greate number dissimilitude coulde bring ouerthrowe buylde vpon similitude mighte saye prophetes place scripture kinges mightie prince haue ample large dominion calledierem 〈◊〉 bothe shepheardes watchemen namely ieremy 2 〈1 line〉 ezechiell 34 c andezech 34 therefore reason mighte aswell alleadged agaynst also mighte saye whose sighte sharpe see one ende diocesse prouince realme another name common vsuall kinges prince minister worde bishop truely similitude sinke people heades bée applyed vnto ciuill gouernment agaynst whiche bée forceable agaynst ecclesiasticall easily farre easily stirre vp séeke alteration also chap 1 7 diuision c pag 43 sect 4 5 controuersie lefte poynte man douteth flocke yet haue inuented straunge definition flocke paule defineth playnely saythe appoynt pastor elder bishop wordes indifferently vsed throughe euery shire prouince realme throughe euery citie towne least man shoulde heere take occasion conclude lawfull one man bee bishoppe pastor whole citie suche london yorke c luke actes dothe declare meaning place sayth appoynted elder throughout euery congregation citie towne great professours gospell make conueniently congregation muste bee rule god haue worde god practise primitiue churche doth cōfute proued tract 8 pastours bishop wherevpon appeareth bothe pastour bishoppe oughte bee made without flocke voyde place flocke realme prouince diocesse call diocesse many may conueniently meete one assemblie congregation meaning sainct paule appeareth practise church tyme tyme whiche haue bothe decreed agaynst founde faulte wyth wandering rouyng ministeries io whitgifte manyfest paule willed titus appoynte presbyteros thattit 1 worde vseth euery citie dothe also saye heereof conclude sequele argument sainct paule willed timothie appoynt minister euery citie ergo muste none admitted ministerie worde suche haue certayne cure therefore one man maye haue ouersighte direction many cure déede paule sayde titus thou shalte appoynte minister worde senior certayne cure admitte none preache gospell except haue one place certenly appoynted vnto reason bin something hath shew argument place act 14 tendeth purpose neyther one worde proue suche maye preache worde haue certayne charge committed vnto contrarie rather paule barnabas thoughe dyd appoynte euery churche minister yet dyd preache themselues also heare reason yet bothe maye true euery churche shoulde haue pastour yet may admitted preache worde haue seuerall church sure vsuall apostle time nowe profitable neither ordeyned without title word siue martyrio siue monasterio manifestly declare councell would haue none admitted ecclesiasticall function without stay liuing either benefice monasterie colledge chappell father many bookes child like eldest brother would without better aduise shake many groundes religion heere agayne wishe pastor able teache beeing vnpossible state nowe content pastor minister doe nothing reade throughout whole booke make maruellous good estate alwayes turne best side outwarde men goe vrge deformity thereof ende mighte remedied lay open shame nakednesse make greater deede haue shewed church standeth muche neede reading minister would make worlde beleeue although great deformitie sore plague churche whiche speake confesse vnwares yet let man come neare heale make gayne sore sore legges therefore haue medicine keepe woundes alwayes greene heale hope purpose keepe churche estate dare say chiefe gayne honour consisteth grounded ruines churche therefore desire tooke vnto io whitgifte omit whatsoeuer héere speake agaynst person purposed absteinethe cause lacke able minister requiting like sorte onely answere selfe labour slaunder cause lacke sufficient number méete minister church neyther religion professed gouernment vsed yet gouernours partly crueltie time past wherein number méete minister haue bin consumed partly vn willingnesse mē present time haue zeale enter calling wished partly nay chiefly principally schismes haue caused cast ministerie wholly forsake pastorall charge yet kéepe prebendes liuings depraue ministerie condemne meanes possible alienate many therefore nothing confesse scarsitie méete able minister derogateth thing eyther doctrine professed church frō kinde gouernment magistrate rather cōmendeth bicause notwithstanding al former impediment yet hath number excellent minister doth continually bréed mo confession tende condemnation adherent haue hindred slaundered gospel realme england papist eyther haue done could possibly fully persuaded one greatest deformity suffered church lacke discipline towardes farre healing sore church suffered greater doe wounde déede reformation pretende nothing méere confusion rather subuersion bothe churche common wealthe also honour gaine verie small yet worthie trust tyme come boyling affection vttered spitefull maner made manyfest pray god imputed vnto day houour gayne bēe vntiue therfore replis full greate absuraities meaning playne though iuste cause bishoppe inhibite preachyng bothe theyr contention also errours yet woulde preache whether byshoppe wyll case theyr owne admytted preache theyr cure elsewhere long vsed selues modestlye quietly taught sounde doctrine began deuide churche make contention restrayned preachyng vntill suche tyme vpon submission reformation shoulde vnto admitted agayne hinc illae lachrymae matter hereto answere ne gry quidem apparell minister tract 7 cause refuse apparell examined chap 1 fyrst diuision c page 52 sect 3 cappe surplis tippet greatest matter striue whych notwithstandyng hath bene enformed church beyonde sea ende iudgementes myghte easlyer agaynst v howbeit thinke attyre vnmeete minister gospell weare surplis especially two bycause suche hurtefull ceremony muche daungerous doe approche nearer seruice▪ worship god io whitgifte yet beginning suche youre pretence neyther thing else contended well knowne men deale hearde certainly perswaded church beyonde sea fully vnderstande procéeding together state thys churche englande woulde bitterly write againste willingly condemne euer dyd anabaptistes reason agaynste apparell chap 1 second diuision c pag 52 sect 4 cause wee lothe meddle many borne hande assertion contrary practise monumentes idolatrie may vsed haue profite bycause thinke pollution sticke thing themselues wearyng suche power pollute make vncleane vsers neyther yet bicause papistes haue superstitiously vsed bycause hauing bene abhominably avnsed haue vse profyte thinges endes wherein wherevnto nowe vsed also hurtful beyng monument idolatrie bring establishe behoueth shoulde manyfeste profite appeare inough saye indifferent owne nature ergo meete doone circumstaunces tymes person profite hurte brother doe require require muste doone done thing whiche called indifferent god haue vse measured referred fyrste glorie profite others io whitgifte true commonly sayde suche errour neyther long agrée neyther yet themselues haue taught pollution dothe sticke thyngs selues wearyng power pollute make vncleane wearoes number caryed away doctrine else refuse come church sermon yea kéep v cōpanie salute v spitte oure face reuile v streates shewe suche lyke villanie vnto v onely bycause apparell manifest declaration thinke v therewith polluted euer wee speake doe polluted lyke maner euen worde god sacramentes haue learned others partner lykewyse chiefe grounde opinion howe didde moue people extremitie haue yet speake defense theyr excessiue raging forsoothe thys geare came pope inuented antichriste therefore abhominable vsed onely reason haue common place haue hitherto bette vpon nowe béeing conuinced manyfest reason seeing manyfolde absurdity wayteth vpon suche assertion passe ouer matter though neuer bene stayned saye cause lothe meddle asthe apparell refused bycause papist vse many borne hand c effecte nowe confessed thyngs whyche papistes haue superstitiously vsed yea whyche haue abhominably abused haue vse profyte en thyngs endes wherein wherevnto nowe vsed lawfull refused therefore wée muste thynke haue doe wyth thys argumente pope inuented ergo bee vsed thys muste bee question whether haue anye vse profite thynges endes wherein wherevnto nowe vsed shifte inuented take awaye obiections whiche maye bée church bell pulpit suche lyke let v procéede reason haue yet proued haue vse profyte thing endes wherin wherevnto nowe vsed therefore take reason yet althoughe haue sufficientely answered vnto haue spoken ceremony treatise also folowethtract 2 matter saye also hurtefull beeyng monumentes idolatrie c whereby acknowledge notwithstanding bée monumentes idolatrie yet maye broughte established manyfeste profite appeare also graunted monument idolatrie may broughte established vpon condition profitable followeth portion replie touching thing indifferent consent vnto prouiso euery man part church iudge determine circumstance time person maketh profitable hurtfull neuer quiet onely whome gouernment church committed whiche prouiso consent matter thus farre agréed chap 1 3 diuision c page 52 sect 4 5 nowe profitable hurtfull also may appeare consider kind men realme papistes eyther stubborne weake respect cannot hurtfull weake call haue made steppe poperie gospell whome good hope may fully gotten proprios non debemus indè aliquid vsurpare vt appareat no pietate ista destruere non auaritia cum verò vsus commune non proprios ac priuatos vel honorem dei veri conuertuntur hoc de illis fit quod de 4 concerning distinction whereby lessen idolatrie papistes haue shewed vanitie therof io whitgifte haue answered whatsoeuer haue said yet reply yt place serue euery circumstance place except say ye stoickes peccata sunt paria sinnes equall chap 5 ninth diuision ansvvere admonition pag 62 sect 1 matter mynde also speake thing second parte admonition c page 56 sect 5 matter say speake againe deede doe againe wherin confounde memorie vnderstanding reader declare selfe ignorant aristotle rule 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 speake one thing generally euen voyde order whiche men haue commonly naturall logike reason neyther excuse selfe saying admonition giueth oftentimes occasion speake laye fault vpon beyng written diuets person matter wherof manifeste vntruth one knewe others blamed repetition one thing twice escape blame whiche myghte haue gathered easyly one place whiche sayde diuerse thing although easy booke yet wil assay doe bothe poyntes followe thinking therby bring treatise good order cast newe againe would complayne mind peruerted might remedie great disorder may boone without chaunging thyng haue set downe io whitgifte haue doone ought haue doone mente playnly haue folowed verbatim booke confute order written thinke confuteth oughte doe admonition written dyuers person one knowing others doing▪ true partes haue one title bée one volume printed one letter one tyme one prynter came abroade together neyther euer separated knowe vnderstande moreouer bewrayeth condemneth one hath conscience wryting vntruthes beginning admonition mētion made treatise woordes two treaty haue heere ensuyng beloued christe whyche yee muste reade c ende bothe treatise thus wrytten weee haue thought good latter end booke sundry consyderations certifye beloued brother reason haue moued v authours treaty keepe backe oure name c fynally order maner bothe treatise stile quotation c doe manyfestly conuince false witnesse bearing vsuall cunning aristotle bolde attribute vnto hym whych founde hym thys place though speake much rule 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 yet hath thing father vpon place méete whyche wryteth booke matter shoulde one matter speake fully one place hée confuteth muste followe order whome hée confuteth whyche hadde doone booke haue doone theyrs eyther woulde youre vnfaithfull dealyng haue bin muche else must sooner easylier haue bin espied youre tauntes leaue selfe haue good grace chap 5 10 diuision c pag 56 sect vlt bee anye argumentes touchyng anye poyntes place whiche haue gathered together one faulte thys coulde bestowe muche tyme makyng harmonie thynges myght haue bene cutte well spared master martyr shoulde haue sayde maye signe purenesse oughte minister séeke answere yet christ beyng puritie selfe néeded nothyng put hym mynde thereof man beyng impure may haue externall instrumentes byd hym remember ought thinke seuerall kyndes habites appoynted men diuerse degrées calling partly purpose man graue apparell vse hymselfe lightly wantonly vse commonly saye suche behauiour becommeth apparell meanyng hys habite apparell oughte put mynde modestie grauitie thys doth argue euen méere ciuill thing maye haue signification whiche ouerthroweth argument whereby woulde proue apparell muste necessitie ecclesiasticall ceremonie bycause attributed vnto signification whether matter meare ciuill meare ecclesiasticall mixt questiō neither yet whether church may confounded wyth common wealth therfore deale anye leaste shoulde confounde matter reader onely speake argument whiche confuted common vsage seuerall habites vniuersities signifie seuerall degrées learnyng seuerall kynde apparell seuerall calling function common wealthe thys apparell doth put euerie man mynde hys duetie yet longer reteined magistrate lawes doe permitte alterable accordyng tymes place person man sayth vertue garmentes power worke godlynesse therefore pretie iestes builded vpon ground vayne toyish topicall place rightly vnderstanded ment thing quae per se aliquid faciunt euery thing signifieth thing sacrament matrimonie asacrament laying hand like papistes vsed vnlawfull signes attributed vnto life death made necessarie saluation image whether grauen paynted wouen agaynste expresse commaundement god therefore vnapte similitude neyther woulde haue vsed well considered martyr wordes answere allegation holy water holy bread pseudoadiaphora according circumstance time place person therefore thing publike writing séeme iudgements distinguishe tyme circumstance doubt well agrée themselues interim doe endeuour deface chap 7 ninth diuision admonition haue shewe euill seing popishe priesthood euill ansvvere admonition pag 240 sect 2 signe token popishe priesthood thenhow apparell signe euill otherwise euil euen thing signified token signes minister worde god good therfore also good man church england ignorant knoweth apparell nowe signes massing priest lawfull minister wherfore shew good euen like manner vniuersities shewe signe degree learning therefore shewe good excepte also condemne degree learning neither straunge matter selfe thing diuerse respect diuerse time signe good euill bel signe euill whē rung cal masse stay stormes tempest selfe bel signe good rung sermon godly action church themselues signe euil whē idolatrie committed false doctrine preached signe good god rightly worshipped worde truely preached many example could bring reasonable mā gather sufficiently confute error futhermore willed absteyne shewe euill ment euill life euil doctrine least doe thing scrupulous conscience c pag 59 tovvardes ende doctor proceedeth proue signes shewes good euil ye author admonition alleage proofe whereof although according manner repeateth diuerse thing alleaged yet summe hathe comprehended argument muche fit conuenient name good men called beltshaser saddrake misacke abednego name daniell three companion name good men therefore good name men name babilonian idol reason doctor iustified good name againe golden calfe signe also vntruth signe true god therefore true signe god concerning note ciuill profession difference betwene cause haue spoken io whitgifte admonition sayth thus haue shew euill say church great iniurie bicause doe tye hir certayne number order minister stake may deuise new function say church christ dothe accuse againe christ esteemeth haue iniurie bicause meanes imagined haue bene carefull prouident enough churche hath left ministerie wherin doth consist lyfe church whereby begotten rawly vnperfect permitting ordering men greate danger errour whiche might haue set kinde degree ministerie wherof god certaine expresse author euer man except ieroboam prophane men either holie wyse great knowledge yt euer much dreame instituting newe ministerie long wandring arke wildernesse came placed ierusalem tell besydes leuites priest ordinarie minister prophetes whiche unmediatly stirred vp god found haue ordeined office title commaunded whether tyme thing added enioyned office priesthobe leuiteship lawe prescribed io whitgifte surely nothing vaine repetition false principle whervpon thys tantalogie multiplication wordes buylded yt institution oft c faulteth still petition principle archbishop institution new ministerie though apostle paule whē placed timothie ephesus titus creta institute new ministerie bicause gaue thē authoritie iurisdiction ouer ye rest afterward proued church whē apoynt one amōg bishop gouern rest scismatis remedium remedie schismes hierom sayth shall large hereafter declared neyther therfore sayde christe doth shew selfe prophet c giftes bycause haue alwayes giftes ioyned graunted man denie reason thus syllogisme without forme function sufficent church haue gift needefull eyther ministring worde sacrament gouernment churche function reckened paule ephesian paule calleth 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 deacon elder haue giftes needful either gouernment church either else ministring worde sacrament therefore function sufficient church superfluous thing make office ther gift furnish haue rather idol officer therefore asmuch gift falleth 〈1 line〉 nnctions altogither vaine vnprositable thing bring office function church besides io whitgifte saye function hath giftes apt fitte discharge annexed giuenin sense euery function sayde haue giftes discharge vnto meane function giftes méete god hath power bestowe true meaning giftes annexed function necessitie whosoeuer called function muste also haue giftes moste vntrue experience dothe teache euery man hath giftes according function althoughe bée lawfully vnto called touching externall calling warde calling none knoweth god himselfe man owne conscience put mée remembraunce whiche maister bullinger writeth anabaptistes lib 5 cap 1 wher confuting reason vse proue christian ought haue magistrate bicause christian perfect themselues gouerne themselues therfore néede subiect superiour authoritie saith thus solent autem anabaptistae iudicis ad tēpus à deo dati constituis c vvhether v humilitie serue brother dayly receyue euery one cōmeth vnto church gētly desire ioy thou makest thy selfe bishop bishop iudge iudge giuen god gaue great honor vnto io whitgifte bicause much adoe made word cyprian erroneous councelthe wordes cyprian discussed tom 1 con carth carthage wherein cyprian himselfe also chiefe author errour recite word doe finde nequè enim quisquam nostrum episcopū se esse episcoporum constituit aut tyrannico terrore ad obsequendi necessitatem collegas suos adigit cum habeat omnis episcopus licentiam libertatis potestatis suae arbitrium proprium tanquā iudicari ab alio non possit cum nec ipse possit alterum iudicare sed expectemus vniuersi iudicium domini nostri iesu christi qui vnus solus habet potestatem praeponendi no ecclesiae suae gubernatione de actu nostro iudicandi neyther dothe v make selfe bishop bishop enforceth fellowes necessitie obeying tyrannicall feare bicause euery bishop hathe freedome libertie free iudgement owne power iudged neyther selfe iudge another bishop let v wayte iudgement lorde iesus christ alone hathe power bothe place v gouernment churche iudge dooing absurde thinke cyprian word generaily vnderstanded kinde iudgement bishop thing shoulde left owne free libertie discretion frée controlement heretike otherwise criminous shall iudged man lefte onely iudgement christe word cyprian vnderstand themthe meaning cyprian take authoritie iudgement aswell synodes archbishop cyprian therfore meaneth word themselues teache one bishop tyrannically rule ouer pleasure abridge libertie vttering iudgement especially synode rashly condenme cyprian councell propounding controuersie rebaptization requireth euery man iudgement therof protesting condemne excommunicate dissent matter therevpon sayth nequè enim quisquam nostrum c meaneth tyrannicum compeil bishop necessarily agrée opinion in▪all thing word licētia libertalis potestatis suae arbitriū propriū 〈1 line〉 nt iurisdiction iudgement opinion one man necessitie bounde frame selfe iudgement opinion therein hath fréedome libertie neyther man allowe authoritie archbishop touching iurisdiction euery bishop church hath frée gouernment ouer stocke al thing belongeth vnto thing happen end archbishop intermedleth serue referred synode word cyprian respect derogate thing iurisdiction archebishops concerning iurisdiction bounde lawes themselues execute lawes made owne priuate authoritie parliament prince neyther controle worst minister dioces obserue lawes rule prescribed therefore excepte meaning haue bishop minister frée lawes subiection superiour prince whiche moste like doe knowe take saying cyprian sense doe sure word doc fauour anarchie may reader easily perceyue cyprian sayth vnto euery one portion flocke appoynted sayth truely yet dothe thereby exempte bishop pastor minister obedience subiection lawfull gouernours due obedience dothe hinder semel imbiberunt nolle deponere nec propositum suum facilè mutare c know certayne neuer laye away haue taken neyther easily chaunge purpose doe reteyne certayne thinges peculiar selues whiche haue vsed yet breaking bonde peace concorde among fellowes wherein neyther compell man appoynte lawe since euery gouernour hathe free iudgement wyll gouernment churche shall render accompt deede lorde cyprian wordes sheweth opinion concernyng suche béeing minister worde sacrificed idol hathe done thus speaketh stephane whome writte epistle haec ad conscientiam tuam frater charissime c followeth well executed one prouince much far lawes required cōuenient state church could ouer christendome may pastor hauing small charge busie heades may finde procure moe matter controuersies eyther able willing compound busie pastor england vnquietnesse lacke abilitie dispatch controuersies themselues author cause doth proue eyther archbishop bishop may thing sufficiently well apperteyne office whole christendome helpe deputy soeuer haue agaynst constrayned make comparison makedifference betwene pope archbishop cause forge vntrue ioyne togither office poynt like pope chalengeth authoritie equall woorde god archbishop thinke nothing lesse short pope oppresseth persecutetth gospel earnestly professe haue suffered persecution therefore comparison odious riotous speach presumptuous becommeth man pretending simplicitie good opinion conceyued well vttered booke spirit hath taught thus dissemble surely euen hath falsified scripture wryters booke hath vttered many prowde contemptuous speaches agaynst superiours hath moued make contention churche euen spiritus mendax spiritus arrogantiae superbiae lying spirite spirite arrogancie pryde frutes cannot procéede spirite acacius paulus minister booke called anacephaleosis calleth 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 c writing augustine booke ad quodvultdeum maketh mention epiphanius byshop cyrus sayth dyed long since speaking foure score heresy wrote also himselfe sixe bookes making mention thing historicall maner disputing nothing either falsehood truthe short bookes made one yet compared diuerse men bookes length word euident augustine neither time dyd see worke epiphanius intituled panarium epiphanius long recountyng historie concerning beginning endeuour countrey heretikes occasiō heresie successe increase suche lyke throughout euery heresie long confuting condemning heresy true scripture interpretation wherfore seeme augustine belyke onely argument prefixed tome bookes epiphanius whiche dothe therefore call shorte bookes least booke called anacephaleosis summe worke called panarium cornarius writethcornarius preface booke epiphanius iudgement addeth wordes vvherefore eyther augustine dyd see worke epiphanius right worke augustine extant loste else augustine dyd deede performe whiche promised reade none doubteth whether bookes epiphanius certaynely kinde answering nexte worst especially vsed agaynst suche approued author bicause men may vnderstande epiphanius wordes reason aerius sie denying difference betwixt shop priell▪ epi li 3 〈◊〉 〈1 line〉 haeres 75▪ whiche déede pinche néere calleth heretikes declare haue founde first setteth downe heresie aērius word talke outrageous becōmed man sayd bishop priest nothing differeth one order honor dignitie bishop layeth handes dothe priest bishop ministreth baptisme dothe priest bishop sayth diuine seruice doth priest bishop sitteth throne dothe priest hathe deceyued many vse captayne dothe little confute heresie aerius reason sorte saye bishop priest equall howe possible order bishop begetter father ingendreth father churche order priest beeing able beget father dothe beget sonnes churche sacrament baptisme father teacher howe possible ordeyne priest hauing imposition hand electe saye equall bishop phantasticalnesse emulation deceyued foresayde aërius proueth errour aud errour heare apostle writte priest deacon dyd write byshops bishop sayth neglect gifte thee whiche thou hast receyued handes presbyterie agayne another place writeth bishop deacon wherefore sayth bishop priest one knoweth whiche ignorante sequele truthe hathe read profounde story preaching newely begonne holy apostle writte according state thing bishop appoynted writte bishop deacon apostle coulde first appoynte thing neede priest deacon bicause two ecclesiasticall matter maye complete founde worthy bishopricke place remayned without bishop neede worthy men bishop bishop appoynted many coulde founde amongst meete priest content one bishop appoynted place vnpossible bishop without deacon holy apostle care deacon shoulde bishop ministerie dyd churche receyue fulnesse dispensation suche state condition place euery thing perfection beginning processe time thing whiche necessarie perfection added c apostle teacheth bishop priest sayth timothie bishop chide priest exhorte father bishop haue doe chide priest authoritie aboue priest also sayth agayne agaynst priest admitte accusation sodenly without two three witness sayde priest admit accusation agaynst bishop neyther write priest shoulde rebuke bishop thus mayest thou sée good reader nought c stormes agaynst epiphanius vnreuerently vseth wyll giue muche cause deale like maner augustine whoaugust ad quodvult matter fully ioyneth epiphanius booke de haeresibus ad quodvultdeum church hath peculiar sea church yet care gouernment ouer also euen chrysostome haue alleaged nothing neyther proue chrysostome gouernment ouer mo church one gréeke scholiast haue answered hath one woorde purpose euery seuerall parish hath pastorthe scholiast falsified c purpose notwithstāding bishop hath care gouernment euen titus creta wordes author sed singulas ciuitates suum habere pastorem euery citie haue hir pastor haue translated euery one shoulde haue proper congregation whereby meane scant good fayth couertly go make reader beleue scholiast would haue minister without proper congregation many like corruption trust reader already sufficiently instructed woordes chrysostome hom 3 act n 〈1 line〉 nne imperium orbis terrarū tenet imperator hic autem vnius ciuitatis episcopus est doth emperour gouerne world man bishop one citie woordes spoken chrysostome sense bishop one citie asmuch subiect affection trouble emperour gouerneth whole worlde chrysostomes meaning woordes following declare wherefore doth place shew difference betwixt emperour byshop largnes straightnesse charge place gouernment say trouble opprobries slaunders subiect vnto wherewith bishop one citie tossed thā emperour whole world chrysostome speaketh hyperbolycally one emperour ouer whole worlde time himselfe bishop care charge diuerse city wherfore must vnderstoode secundùm subiectam materiam prolocutor therefore respecte archbishop metropolitane tyrst ordeyned haue neede archebishop metropolitane agayne cause also appeareth 〈◊〉 truthe whiche see bishop kepte selues within owne di 〈1 line〉 cesse brake others diocesse fyrste maye doone withoute archebishoppe doone archebishop himselfe giuing licence vnto wandering minister goe thoroughout fewe dosen diocesse therefore office archbishop necessarie respecte yet muste nowe io whitgifte councell flatte agaynst councell antioche canon ouerthroweth assertion directely ninth canon woordes whereof haue repeated youre vntrue allegation manner compelleth repeate agayne reader may see eye truthe doings although perteyne office metropolitane archebishoppe call synodes yet one woorde thereof cannon yet propounding matter synodes seyng bishoppes keepe themselues within theyr owne diocesse doe auouche without truthe notwithstanding sayde thing doe perteine office archebishoppe yet also comprehended canon rather confirmation office otherwyse contentes canon onely firste sayeth behoueth bishoppes euery countrey prouince knowe theyr metropolitane bishoppe haue care ouersighte gouernment ouer whole prouince whiche woordes authoritie name metropolitane archebishoppe moste pl 〈1 line〉 ynely confirmed proued permanent 〈1 line〉 ce secondly canon willeth haue businesse doe resorte metropolitane citie whereby also giuen metropolitane bishop greate preheminence therefore followeth immediatly shoulde excell reste honour bishoppes shoulde doe nothing importance without according olde rule made forefather onely thyngs whiche perteyne theyr owne diocesse place possession perteine vnto whiche wordes séeth preheminence giuen metropolitane ouer bishoppes hys prouince iurisdiction bishop owne diocesse place perteyning vnto also noted councell sayeth secundiòn antiquam à patribus nostris regulam constitutam according auncient rule appointed oure forefather whyche argueth greate antiquitie office followeth euery haue thing amended instruction symple studious truth haue beene bolde vtter whiche thinke doubting also lyght truth shall able scatter mystes reason shall go darken clearnesse thereof io whitgifte surely blottes manifest woulde séeme make wisely done slenderly passe ouer well thinke treatise touching prayer subiect tothe pith replie concerning prayer many reprehension shoulde worthie commendation learning reason truth godlinesse except vaine wordes learning fancy reason lye truth contempt good lawes order vnséemely iestes bée godlynesse else thys treatise truely settled selfe striue contende béene desyrous peruert simple rather instruct would neuer vpon weake ground féeble reason rather vaine fansyes haue gone depraue worthie booke whiche haue sayde able shewe thing especially touching order maner matter prayer consonant worde god neyther haue spoken forme prayer alledged one text scripture one sentence auncient late wryter doe thinke men beléeue vpon bare wordes sacrament else intollerable negligence rather contempt neyther one shoulde either borne nourished either permitting three foure communicate alone else letting depart go easily away great fault ought seuerely punished io whitgifte neither differ substance set take cut friuolous vaine excuse vsed eyther neglect contemne holy communion certaine circumstance vsed altogither agrée first vncleannesse cannot come moste parte infected disease also preached fruite thereof part hyndred whylest common people attende oftentymes rather whiche done taught thyng indifferent sayde ought abolyshed whiche thyngs must refused abuse edifying churche worshyppyng god bée vtterly remoued abuse crepte abuse muste taken awaye thing still remayne thing bée abrogated bicause kepte papistes would bée meruailous afterwardes greatly abused holydayes nowe vsed rather meanes withdrawe men onlythe vse holydaies stoppe superstition superstition dayes selues kyndes superstition whatsoeuer god publike congregation truly worshipped sacramentes rightly ministred scripture godly homily read worde god faythfully preached whiche chiefe principall meanes withdrawe men onely superstition kynde errour likewyse chap 1 2 example one chiefe holydayes generally longest tyme obserued churche feaste easter whiche kept dayes fewer howe many thousandes wyll saye ignoraunt papistes also professe gospell haue celebrated dayes diligent heede taken vnto theyr lyfe earnest deuotion praying hearing worde god thynke haue well celebrated feaste easter yet haue thus notably deceyued selues saint paule teacheth celebratyng feaste the1 cor 5 christian easter iewes easter certayne dayes sheweth wee must keepe feaste dayes lyfe vnleauened bread sinceritie truthe see obseruing feaste easter certayne dayes yeare doth pul myndes aunciēt father al late wryters al learned men confesse especially séeing augustine ad ianu 119 sayeth obseruation easter hath authoritie scripture séeing also feaste others allowed confession church heluetia wordes confession moreouer church may christian libertieconfess helue kepe religiouslye remembraunce christe birth circumcision passion resurrection ascention heauen sending holy ghoste vnto disciple wee well allowe therefore cannot marueyle boldely without grounde abuse sake condemne euen feaste vsed allowed apostle continued churche without contradiction one worthy credite daye surely may well reason scripture read heretikes haue greatly abused th place paule 1 cor 5 nothing purpose though borrows metaphor iewes passeouer moue corinthiās purenesse integritie lyfe yet doth abrogate feaste easter ment thing yet must haue bene vnderstanded iewes passeouer celebration memorie christes resurrection whiche commonlye call easter dothe hée sayeth whole lyfe christian man ought bee perpetuall faste denye maye bée anye daye tyme appoynted faste christian man muste euer serue god worshyppe hym shall therefore certayne dayes appoynted verye symple argument saint paule wylleth v purge olde leuen maye newe lumpe c also kepe feaste olde leuen neither leuen malitiousnesse c therefore maye celebrate feaste easter yeare denye argument obseruing easter doth rather put v mynde doctrine gospell drawe v nere consyderation benefites wée haue receyued death passion resurrection christe suppose fewe godlye disposed christian doe thynke moste conuenient profitable feastes especiallye shoulde bée churche reteyned neyther euerye contentious person imagination surmyse maye happen bée greatlye regarded shoulde bée sufficient condemne anye thyng maye haue profitable vse churche whome euer inuented much lesse hath bene vsed apostle selues euer sythence theyr tyme continued churche haue shewed feaste haue bene th 〈1 line〉 weakenesse man greate therefore hée continuallye taught hée shoulde tymes remember dutie verye necessarye haue certayne feastes wherein readyng hearyng scripture men maye particularlye styrred remembraunce depe consyderation principall denye power churche proofe whereof wyll take fourth commaundement interpretation doctor alloweth 174 page whiche god lycenseth leaueth libertie euery man worke sixe dayes weeke rest seuenth day seeing necessarie rest body io whitgifte god gaue libertie commaundement appoynt solemne feast dayes besides sabboth feast easter pentecoste tabernacle c withoute restraynte libertie therefore interpretation power authoritie ouer subiectes externallthe magistrate hathe authoritie abridge externall libertie libertie taken away matter bodily affayres wherefore maye call bodily labour compell vnto shall god instruction people whiche shoulde counted bondage seruitude man rest seuenth daye commaunded labour sixe dayes permitted biddeth rest seuenth daye dothe directly agaynst cōmaundement dothe restrayneth men bodily labour sixe dayes therefore reason lyke yet commaundement bodily rest vpon seuenth day sundrie case maye man selfe muche lawfull commaundement magistrate necessitie broken thinges indifferent priuate men willes subiect suche haue authoritie ouer therefore ought consent determination matter except shewe selues wilfull whiche great faulte deserueth muche punishment one holy day besides lordes day shewed parte workes thinke approued holy dayes nowe question sayeth deede institution condemne church vse churche englande neyther thinges whiche meete reformed one thing mistike thing condemne one thing condemne thing churche condemne churche place cited epistle galatian collossians mention holydayes eyther sainctes appeareth also defendeth church churche geneua answereth obiecte keping sainctes dayes holydayes called besides lordes daye whiche woulde haue lordes day kepte still day reste bodily labour may appeare place vpon collossians especially alleaged institution meaneth nothing lesse holydayes take vpon detende may appeare first place collossians sayeth dayes reste whiche vsed vsed pollicie sake nowe well knowne pollycie way preserue estate thinges keepe good continuance successe well beastes menne labour sixe dayes rest seuenth tendeth pollicie wealth people preseruation good order shoulde many dayes wherein menne cease worke beyng thing breedeth idlenesse consequently pouertie besides disorder vice alwayes go companie idlenesse place institution declareth himselfe yet playnely sayeth odde holydayes without superstition ordeyned onely obseruing discipline order whereby giueth vnderstande would haue holydayes tyme bestowed exercise discipline order churche reste altogither dayes free laboured appeareth holydayes ascribed vnto sainctes seruice booke iuste cause man cannot safely without exception subscribe vnto seruice booke io whitgifte soeuer caluines practise churche geneua yet place dothe iudgement euidently appeare neyther doth man alwayes vse himselfe alloweth may circumstance make commendable one place condemneth thing vnlawfull muste also condemne church vse though wholly yet poynt muche therefore caluine condemne church obseruing suche dayes manifest argument condemned obseruing dayes church déede one thing mislike thing condemne maketh suche sturre churche matter disorderly sayde onely mislyke also condemne place caluine epistle galat mente onely lordes daye dayes also obserued reformed church place maketh generall answere soone perceyued suche reade place also shall per vse woordes vpon seconde chapter collossians shall finde lyke sense sayeth vsed order pollicie wee dissent thinke lyke manner howbeit wée vnderstande doth ecclesiasticall order pollicie wordes go place galatian sayeth obseruing dayes dothe also perteyne ad regimen ecclesiae gouernmentcaluin 4 gal churche better order pollicie haue certayne dayes appoynted wherein people may reste bodily labour labour spiritually heare worde god c whiche caluine called order pollicie externall rest sabboth daye commaundement god constitution churche neyther hath churche respect worldly pollicie appoynting holydayes ecclesiasticall pollicie whiche consisteth hearing wordes ministring sacramentes publike prayer lyke godly action place institution conuince shifting coniectures mere follie therein playnely declareth allowing church 〈1 line〉 holydayes sunday whiche haue denied opinion former two place haue tolde meaneth discipline order pollicie whereby giueth vnderstande nothing lesse whiche woulde conclude beyng haue proued first good yet beyng necessarie abused horribly papist beyng good better ought remayne churche io whitgifte reason sufficient proue good abuse hath bene suche beyng remoued thing may still legges therefore argumente bin framed thys sort office euery minister gospell preach baptisme iohn peter thomas minister gospell ergo ought preach baptisme bin good order touching forme though matter line〉 verse 13 14 15 manifest baptise christ without preaching buta slender proofe vse thereby condemne sinceritie sarramentes administring church c pag 125 lin 13 whereas say manifest sauiour christ baptised without preaching would know one worde doth declare contrary rather doth appeare luke seemeth note playnely sauiour christe baptised whenluke 3 people baptised people haue shewed baptised immediatlye heard iohn preache therefore lyke sauiour christ baptised yt heard iohn preach probable sauiour christ honor ministery god hand men far would vouchsafe baptised iohn would neglect passe dead sacramentes without effect except worde preached ministred déede adherentes playne termes affirme saying seales without writing playne blankes whiche doctrine sauoureth strongly anabaptisme doth depriue effectes fruites sacramentes haue bene partaker without worde preached ministred consequently euen selfe like sermon christening therefore doctrine must necessitiethe doctrine replier tēdeth worde answere argument doctor bringeth proue may minister sacramentes wherof first philip 8 actes baptised would gladly aske doctor able proue philip deacon rather philip apostle seing luke speaketh nicene creede worde god collected famous councell nice confounde detestable heresie arrians therefore meete reade christian congregation neyther mislyke arrians suche lyke whiche secte gyue iust suspitions bee fautors creede thys forme framed apostle tyme bycause heresie arrius hatched therefore good reason say read apostle tyme communion ergo ought read thys argumente intollerable nicene creede read communion therefore communion sincerely ministred three reason taken ab authoritate negatiuè therefore force excepte wee wyll also graunte bee true suche lyke scilicet christian prince therefore maye haue christian prince ciuill politike lawes ergo ought haue none churche externall peace vnder persecution ergo haue peace christian proprietie nothing thinges common ergo man may haue knowne haue read ecclesiasticall story heathen obiect christian tymes past reproche god beleeued hanged vpon crosse thought good testifie ashamed therefore god often vsing signe crosse carefulnesse good mynde keepe amongest open profession christ crucifyed although commended yet meanes might otherwise haue kept lesse daunger vse crossing thought vse crosse best meanes yet shoulde haue beene bolde haue brought holy sacrament baptisme mingle ceremony inuentions men sacramentes institution god brought vpon good grounde lord left marke curse whereby might perceyued come forge man brayne beganne forthwith yet swadling cloutes superstitiously abused appeareth tertullian also booke de corona militis christian superstition woulde doe nothing take nothing hande vnlesse crossed went came sat lay downe rose superstition alwayes strengthned spreddeth selfe time came crossing men vnto crossing euerie thing vsed wherevpon chrysostome commendeth crossing cuppe man drinkevpon 1 tim 4 cap meate eaten graunted vppon consideration haue mencioned auncient christian well yet followeth wee shoulde doe liue amongest nation whiche doe cast v teeth reproche v crosse christ liued amongst turkes matter might peraduenture question whether shoulde doe hauing sore vse playster nowe liue among papistes doe contemne crosse christ esteeme woodden crosse true crosse christ suffering ought nowe doe cleane contrariewise olde chrystians abolishe vse cross contrarie disease must haue contrarie remedyes therefore olde christian delyuer crosse christ contempt often vse crosse christian nowe take away superstitious estimation ought take away vse io whitgifte thinke supposition parte bée true also perswaded originall cause vsing signe lawfull good yet thing selfe afterwardes abused cause vsing continue vayne shall haue best game c pag 156 sect 2 althoughe vnreasonable inoughe shoulde giue men leaue complayne trouble glorieth troubling yet vntollerable besides iniurie dothe angry wyll lay handes selues casting themselues liuings euer cast tully maketh mention one c fimbria whiche caused q sceuola singular man wounded sawe dyed conuented iudges beeing asked accuse answered dyd suffer whole weapon wherewith striken enter hys body euen doctor contenteth selfe doe iniuries vnto men accuseth also doe vnto selues would willingly suffer weapon enter farre would haue io whitgifte trust one iustly saye haue without great cause molested suche whome haue meanes iniuried refuse answere satisfie yea desire maye come triall shall many slaunderous spéeches togither author founde c fimbria proude sedicious romane one disquieted thec fimbria q sceuola state common wealth greatly enuied superiours q sceuola wyse prudent senatour one liued authoritie obserued lawes selfe caused obserued sceuola surely neyther credite wisdome authoritie cōmon wealth diligent obseruer good order lawes condition come nearer fimbria conclude shall doe selfe haue done iniurie prosecute vttermoste spare neuer entreated holde peace greatest iniurie acknowledge selfe guiltie vnto colledge long suffered contrarie expresse othe vsurpe place therein great hinderaunce disquieting thereof c pag 156 sect 2 conscience bindeth man depart liuing place liketh order vsed inough abstayne euill declare vnlawfulnesse thē calling suffer reformation power eyther absteyning declaration thys vnlawfulnesse trouble moued cause giue place like disorder yea lesse cause cause trouble departure place roome made lyke disorder whiche misliked whiche hurte companie congregation suche place io whitgifte sworne kéepe order kéeping liuing honest men lyke equal rather better might supply place thinke ought rather satisfie othe refuse liuing wyll auoyde periurie yea though méete person succéede case man shall directly sweare eyther doe thing tyme leaue place time neyther thing othe required leaue place still vsurpe least space fiue yeres thinke ought displaced periurie whiche greater matter eyther cappe surplesse doe nowe put case men may vnderstande euery man displaced displaced without great vrgent occasion woulde enter thys vayne vrged therefore answere one worde haue put man liuing greater cause ashamed cō playne iniurie doe according othe duetie c pag 156 tovvards ende doctor easinesse depart liuing rather woulde cause trouble giueth men great cause doubt whiche hauing diuers great liuings offyces c likelyhoode minister execute office contrarie repugnant ecclesiasticall function séeing haue declared ciuill office nowe committed bishop cleargie necessarie helpes calling moste profitable good quiet gouernment churche argument selfe falleth grounde may well reason thus multitude greatnesse thing required christian suche infirmitie frayltie man great nothing giue selfe spirituall meditation neuer meddle worldly affayres able doe full duetie therefore christian man may practise suche thing meddle worldly ciuill matter argument roote anabaptisme chap 2 2 diuision c pag 167 midst hande man able reache heerein considered apostle whome office ministerie dyd wholly occupie set worke could admitte charge yea fayne cast whych cleare none lyue nowe beside function admit publike calling story knowne act apostle euen tune kept togither ierusalemact 6 taught churche fayne might better attende vnto preaching praying two thyngs luke summarily setteth foorth office ministerie giue ouer charge prouiding poore vnto others bycause able much apostle endued suche giftes none haue beene since shall hereafter could discharge togither office minister also deacon howe shoulde man founde togither office discharge office ciuill magistrate apostle would haue office deacon whiche ecclesiasticall therefore kynde ministerie ioyned vnto howe muche lesse wyll suffer ministerie ioyned ciuill offyce therefore kynde reason teacheth easier mingling whych one kynde whiche dyuers kyndes io whitgifte euident apostle ascention christ heauen vntillwhy apo stles left deaconship caluine time english church geneua condemneth ministring eyther sacrament priuate house woman 〈1 line〉 whitgifte néedlesse proofes yet learned mē cōtrary iudgemēt 〈1 line〉 ow beit man sayth woman may baptise ordinarily sacramonts may administred priuate place otherwise vpon vrgent occasion respecte learned man dothe condemne ministring sacramentes priuate place c peter martyr vpon 11 chapter 1 epistle corinthes describing corruption lordes supper noteth one churche communicate altogither corruption diuers place tymes past complayneth nowe io whitgifte martyr place speaketh agaynste priuate mass complainte maketh concerning wherein fully agrée neyther doe like allowe suche withdrawe themselues lordes table supper celebrated neuer loue rehearse author wordes bycause make gather collection owne contrarie meaning author place reader shall easily perceiue wil please reade martyr place quoted surely great iniurie wreste order celebrating communion allowed church englande man else speaketh agaynst pryuate mass deepe profounde collection c bucer first booke kingdome christ 7 chapter proueth 10 corinthes whole churche shoulde receiue supper lorde togyther vse church god behalfe ought great diligent endeuour restored vnto church contempt mystery partaker called io whitgifte bucer speaketh nothing place touching question vnto agrée woulde haue communion ministred publike congregation denyeth except vpon occasion sicknesse c haue declared woulde haue moste parte present communicate defendeth contrarie yet rest may secluded whole drift reproue communicate prohibite distribution supper willing moe fewer competent number may communion c beza vvestphalus sheweth decent baptisme ministred church standing houres minister vpō necessitie called ought ministred priuate house might ministred priuate house yet otherwise minister io whitgifte vntruely report beza wordes onely sheweth place order church remaineth doth prescribe certaine rule church neyther méete shoulde case speaketh baptizing priuate house doth simplie condemne soeuer iudgement poynt mynd sure bynde church thinke teach soundly sacrament doth though agrée circumstance c caluin institution 4 booke chapter 15 sect 20 21 proueth baptisme ought ministred priuate men woman io whitgifte minister church ye ordinarie minister baptisme neither may chalenge function vnto thēselues ordinarily yet vpon occasion priuate person baptise baptisme good lawfull euen circumcision true circumcision ministred sephora haue proued tract 9 cap 5 c • iudgement late writer touching ceremony apparell whose secrete epistle doctor alledgeth appeareth place following cited work printed published themselues wherof also alledged answerer examiner diuers place purpose wherevnto referre reader bucer vpon 18 mathewe saith say nothing alwayes obiect greater thing must vrged reformation ceremony thereby defending reliques antichrist much ceremony testimony religion agreement betweene christe belial whiche sincere christian abide nothing antichrist io whitgifte bucer sayth truely reformation ceremony sought neglected neyther sincere christian abyde thing antichriste antichristes purpose reformation ceremony church englande whiche antichristian ceremony abandoned remaine purged al opinion antichristianitie bucer ment nothing lesse ceremony nowe reteined church englande vse maye euidently appeare whiche haue alledged tract 7 cap 5 5 diuision chap 7 diuision 4 c peter martyr vpon 10 chap second boke king saith lutheran must take heede least whilest cutte many popishe error followe iehu reteining also many popish thing defende still reall presence bread supper image vestiments c saith religion must wholly reformed quick io whitgifte martyr nameth popishe thing lutheran obserue reall presence image popish apparell vsed masse doth meane church hath refused opinion apparell reteine haue declared tract 7 chap 5 4 diuision purpose speaketh concerning god thanked religion wholly reformed euen quicke churche c bullinger decade 5 booke ninth sermon saythe sauiour christe apostle vsed accustomed apparell supper although tymes paste minister put kynde cloake vpon common apparell yet done neyther example chryste apostle tradition man ende example priestes apparell olde lawe caste vpon minister ministration supper sayth hee haue learned long agoe onely leuiticall ceremony abrogated also ought brought agayne churche man therfore seeing light gospell vnder shadowe lawe worthily reiecte massing leuiticall apparell io whitgifte neyther reteine massing leuiticall apparell apparell onely bullinger himselfe alloweth diuers epistle written purpose touching matter haue expressed tract 7 chapter 5 6 diuision c c gualter vpon 21 actes among others bringeth one reason improue paules shauing head gospel beene preached twentie yeares therefore infirmitie iewes ought haue bene borne saith teacheth howe muche superstitious maisters ceremony hurte gospell nourishe weaknesse fayth long keping ceremony long bearing hinder doings minister feruent io whitgifte gualter wordes sayth nothing poynt churche speaketh truely nothing purpose gualter hath sufficiently shewed opinion matter onely written epistle printed bookes epistle commentary vpō first corinthian surely suche weight authority purpose take great aduauntage indéede cause opinion hath small credite alledging ¶ imprinted
